data.title: Good breakfast place
data.text: I had lunch here and the food was good.  It is clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  I would recommend.

data.title: Great diner, many choices, good prices, easy to find
data.text: Stopped by for a group lunch. Was impressed with the many options and costs were good. Good food, great for people of all ages and good for kids (where they won't bother anyone if they make too much noise). Just off Main St and 400 S.

data.title: Great breakfasts!!
data.text: we found this great breakfast (also serves lunch) spot across street and 1 block from our hotel Little America, they cook it right in sight and to your specs and modifications, delicious also!

data.title: Really Good Local Diner.
data.text: Stopped her for a wonderful, diner-style breakfast on a Sunday. I loved the fact that the owners kids were there helping, and that the staff was attentive to he customers, and knew many on a first name basis. I love this! Traditional American eats on a budget - the best!

data.title: Greasy...
data.text: You smell the grease when you walk by. Going in and it is stronger. It is fast food. I had a tuna melt and the tuna was very strong. The fries and sauce were good. It is no frills for sure and not expensive. Not one I would go back to.

data.title: No frills, budget-friendly breakfast
data.text:
First off, I have to say, the staff is friendly and the restaurant is clean and spacious. It's also in a convenient location along the street. This is the kind of place where you order at the counter and they call out your number to pick up your food. We probably waited about 10 minutes for our food, and it wasn't particularly busy. Great place for reading a newspaper. Service was a bit slow, but there appeared to be only one cook working at the time.

We spotted this restaurant on our way driving into Salt Lake City. We were hungry for breakfast and were hoping to discover a good, downtown, spot to eat but was a bit underwhelmed. If you are looking for simple breakfast for a reasonable price, this may be what you are looking for, but this is not a fancy omelette place. I ordered a ham and cheese omelette, and the ham was fine, but I will never acquire a taste for American cheese in an omelette...ever. 

I understand now why people recommend the breakfast special--I'm sure it's the best value. Breakfast Special includes 3 sausage links, home fries, 2 eggs, toast and Jelly for $5.95

data.title: Nothing Fancy Here ...
data.text: .... but good food for good prices. I just happened to walk by and decided to try it out for breakfast. Nice selection and clean. Excellent - at least for breakfast.

data.title: Great cafe for quick meal
data.text: Needed a quick lunch and this was it - good food and nice service.  Came back the next day for breakfast and brought a friend.

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: Great downtown location, friendly service, clean restaurant great food for a great value, not to many places left to get sausage and eggs for 5.95, you order at the counter, they call your number when food is ready, I will make this my breakfast choice anytime I'm downtown SLC, I look forward to trying a new item on my next visit.

data.title: Awesome place
data.text:
Staff is always super friendly. The food is good. The prices are low. 
I usually go for breakfast. Their daily special is the best. 
I go in and sit down and read the paper they have and enjoy a good breakfast. 
It's right off the Courthouse trax station

data.title: Very Good Food
data.text: They open for breakfast but I have only ever had lunch here. Their chef salad is very good and a huge serving. I also like their bacon cheeseburger and chicken club. Portions are big and the prices are very reasonable. Dino is an excellent cook and the cashiers are friendly. I would recommend it highly.

data.title: Good for eating on a budget
data.text: Food was pretty good, great for travel on a budget, nothing too amazing but worth a trip for a quick and affordable meal.

data.title: Good food, great value
data.text: You order at the counter and they call your number when your order is ready.  Drinks are self-serve.  The food was very good and well-priced.   The tables were clean and the whole place pleasantly well-kept.  We enjoyed the large windows giving us a view of all the pedestriian and street traffic.  Definitely, thumbs up!

data.title: Best Inexpensive Breakfast
data.text: This is an unpretentious eatery with good basic food, inexpensive, and a friendly atmosphere. The eating area is clean and tables are spaced a good distance apart from each other. Customers place their order and pick it up when their number is called. The eggs, the toast, and the home fries were properly prepared and plentiful. The customers were some tourists and customers but this is clearly a beloved local establishment. The location is central. Four blocks from the great Mormon Temple.

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: Great breakfast in a historic building. Typical American breakfast menu, no frills, just good. Friendly staff, good coffee. prices reasonable.

data.title: good sandwhich
data.text: this restaurant  was the closest restaurant to the hotel and their sandwhiches were really good and reasonable.

data.title: A king-sized disappointment!
data.text: We tried this place because it opened earlier than anywhere else near our hotel. What a let down. I ordered an oatmeal and fruit cup, each for $1.75. Imagine my surprise when my fruit cup was one of those tiny Dole peaches containers you buy at the store in a four pack for $2!!! My husband had French toast; not only did it have margarine on it instead of butter, but it also tasted of peppers (that must have been on the grill prior to his order being cooked). The restaurant itself is quite dingy and dirty. Overall it was a poor value with crummy food.

data.title: Good, clean and cheap!
data.text: We had breakfast here several times.  Prices are great - we had the special one day.  It consisted of two eggs scrambled, best fried potatoes and three chipolata sausages which were great.  This was 4.85.  Had a three egg omelette with filling that was around $6.00.  The food came off the grill clean!  It has an open kitchen, the area doesnt look that good but the food and service were great.  Didnt eat here at night, would definitely eat here again.

data.title: Excellent Breakfast!
data.text: We ate here this morning while in town for a business meeting.  YUMMY! Had the eggs and bacon. Simple, cooked exactly how I ordered. Home fries were perfect....thinly sliced potatoes cooked to perfection.  We'll be back tomorrow!!

data.title: Great Food And Affordable Prices
data.text: No doubt the best greek salad I had in years. The prices were so affordable and the establishment is large with plenty of seating. The staff are friendly and efficient. I found out about this place the day before I left Salt Lake City. I wished I had found it earlier.
